basics.name: Jakapop Khongnawang
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025. After graduation, I hope to work as a software engineer!

volunteer.summary: Participated in local beach clean-up initiatives, contributing to the preservation of Hawaii's pristine coastal ecosystems. Collaborated with community members to remove debris and promote environmental sustainability.
highlights: Engaged in regular clean-up events organized by environmental organizations.

volunteer.summary: Served as a Volunteer Coordinator for the Kapiolani Community College Blood Drive, a vital community service initiative. Led a dedicated team in organizing and facilitating blood donation campaigns, contributing to saving lives within the local community.
highlights: Coordinated successful blood donation events, ensuring a steady supply of blood for medical emergencies.
Recruited and educated volunteers, enhancing the effectiveness of the blood drive program.

awards.title: Pell Grant
awards.summary: Received a Pell Grant through FAFSA to support my higher education expenses.
